intro: Alchornea liukiuensis var. formosae, commonly known as the Taiwan alchornea, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that are often surrounded by bracts. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
